title: Pipeline Zebrabox Treatment
text: Working with the Zebrabox to monitor Daphnia magna behaviour, i began developing a pipeline for automatic high-troughput analysis.

title: Who am I ?
text:
I am a PhD student in ecotoxicology and environmental chemistry, investigating the toxicity of both untreated and advanced oxidation-processed nanoplastics and microplastics—whether alone or in combination with emerging co-contaminants—on aquatic organisms such as Daphnia magna and Chlamydomonas reinhardtii. Additionally, I manage data processing, visualization and produce visually engaging reports using Quarto.

What about my research ?
Simply put, ecotoxicology is the study of how contaminants affect living beings, from the molecular level to entire ecosystems. Basically, I study just how far we’ve managed to throw nature off balance.

  
    
  
  
    Daphnia magna
    
      As a primary consumer in freshwater, Daphnia magna is transparent—ideal for observing morphological changes and pollutant sensitivity.
    
  


  
    Chlamydomonas reinhardtii
    
      At the base of the trophic chain, Chlamydomonas reinhardtii 
      is highly sensitive and grows rapidly, making it ideal for ecotoxicology 
      studies.
